user.title: Welcome to your powerHELPER
user.description:
Choose a name for your home installation. This name will later be shown in the device overview.
Note: All sensors must have the device_class "power".

grid.title: Configure grid power
grid.description:
In this step, you define how the power at the electricity meter is determined.
You can either use a single sensor for total grid power OR two separate sensors for grid consumption and grid feed-in.

data_description.netz_leistung:
Total power at the electricity meter. Can be provided in W or kW.
Positive value: grid consumption.
Negative value: grid feed-in.
data_description.netz_bezug:
Power consumed from the grid. Can be provided in W or kW.
The value must always be positive.
data_description.netz_einspeisung:
Power fed into the grid. Can be provided in W or kW.
The value must always be positive.

pv.title: Configure PV power
pv.description:
OPTIONAL

In this step, the PV power at the inverter is defined.
Note: If no PV sensor is selected, all subsequent calculations will be performed without PV generation and fewer sensors will be created.

data_description.pv_leistung:
Current power of the photovoltaic system. Can be provided in W or kW.
The value must always be positive.

battery.title: Configure battery power
battery.description:
OPTIONAL

In this step, you define how the battery power is determined.
You can either use a single sensor for total battery power OR two separate sensors for charging and discharging.

data_description.akku_leistung:
Total battery power. Can be provided in W or kW.
Positive value: battery is discharging.
Negative value: battery is charging.
data_description.akku_leistung_invertiert:
Positive value: battery is charging.
Negative value: battery is discharging.
data_description.akku_laden:
Power at which the battery is being charged. Can be provided in W or kW.
The value must always be positive.
data_description.akku_entladen:
Power at which the battery is being discharged. Can be provided in W or kW.
The value must always be positive.
data_description.akku_prio:
The battery is supplied with PV power first, and the house is supplied afterwards.

For example, for batteries with a DC connection and a direct link to the PV modules.
Default behavior: PV power supplies the house first and charges the battery with surplus energy.

error.choose_either_total_or_split: Please choose either a total sensor OR two separate sensors, not both.
error.missing_required_sensors: Please select a valid combination of sensors.
